Projects

Football Team Randomizer App

React ⁞ Redux ⁞ Axios/Thunk ⁞ Restful API ⁞ Laravel ⁞ Heroku Laravel Deployment ⁞ Git

Come On You ____! is a React/Redux frontend and Laravel RESTful API backend app that I built alone during Week 13 of the developme coding bootcamp as a "technical challenge". We were given a brief to create an app that takes a list of 10 players and randomly assigns them to 5-a-side football teams. We were also challenged to add more functionality of our choosing. I added features like picking the # of players on each team, setting the team name, further shuffling the teams, and saving the scores of the matches.

Movie Hopper Web App

HTML/CSS ⁞ React ⁞ Redux ⁞ Git/GitFlow ⁞ Laravel API ⁞ JavaScript ⁞ Team-based development

We were provided the challenge to develop a web app in teams of four during Week 12 of our coding bootcamp using the knowledge we had learned up to that point. I was nominated by developme to lead my team and work on the frontend. We created the "movie hopper" web app to list movies that people in our cohort liked. It also allows you to see who likes the same movies by selecting multiple names. The front end is React/Redux and the backend is a Laravel API with 2 tables in a many-to-many relationship.

Veterinary Practice Site

LEMP Stack ⁞ Laravel ⁞ MySQL ⁞ APIs ⁞ Authentication ⁞ AWS/Capistrano ⁞ CD

This mock veterinary practice database web application was developed over 2 weeks of the developme bootcamp learning and applying the skills listed above. It uses Laravel Blade to display lists of owners and their animals from the database. It contains forms that allow for adding/updating these based on your user role. We also developed an API with Laravel that can be used to query and update the database (based on OAUTH and user role). Finally we deployed the site on AWS and set up Capistrano to enable Continuous Deployment of updates to the site.

Ping Pong Scoring App

React ⁞ Redux ⁞ Restful API ⁞ Translation ⁞ Axios/Thunk ⁞

This is a React/Redux app I built during Week 11 of the developme coding bootcamp. We built up the app throughout the weeks exercises learning Redux, React Redux (subscribing and dispatching), as well as API actions to utilize a pre-existing backend API. The app is meant to be used to keep score for ping pong games. You can configure player names, the winning # of points, and serve frequency. Then you're able to keep score while playing the game. Finally you can see the history of past matches that were played. I also did a basic translation set up to Esperanto.

Photography Site

HTML ⁞ CSS ⁞ Atomic Design ⁞ OOCSS ⁞ Design Interpretation ⁞ Responsive Design

For this page I was given a design in Figma and created the page in HTML and CSS from the ground up during Week 2 of the developme coding bootcamp. I started with creating a set of re-usable components using atomic design, then built up the full pages to the design specification.
